@ks85: In every long Header (Description) of my uploads. You can click on "twentyforty" then on few my torrents.

@kzrockz: As first and most important - you should check in "Peers" Tab  are you connected to my seeding server (usually only BitTornado with 100%). I have 3 Gbps upload speed, currently.

2nd: You should wait at least 20 minutes and watch there have you (your BitTorrent) received something from my server. It looks as long time to monitor, but you should be aware that I could send packets to 32 at time, and you must wait to be served.

If you cannot connect to my server, you might have wrong settings (usually wrong Encryption or too low  TCP port), my IP is blocked by your firewall or by your PeerBlock, or - your provider blocked my address or range of. 

Also, bear in mind, that torrent client programs behaving badly in cases of so called "partial downloads" - for example, one choose just How I met your mother from 1.24 GB pack and by that gets lowest priority from ones who have 100% - also, your EXCHANGE with fellow peers determines your so called "inner swarm rating" and if one has low upload to others - usually get nothing from others 'cause their programs mark these as "uncooperative" and selfish swarm members.
